title: Low FPS on high end graphics card. (GTX 1080 TI
body:
Hello.

I have had horrible FPS for a very long time, and I'm getting very tired of it. Having spent so much money on my computer, I don't understand why the only game, League of Legends, is performing this badly.

Specs:

* Asus STRIX 1080 IT OC

* Intel cCore i7-7820x 4.5GHZ

* MSI 299x Tomahawk

* INTEL SSD 500GB x3 RAID

* NZXT Kraken x62

* Seasonic Plat 860watt 80 Plus

* Corsair DDR4 Vengeance DDR4 32GB



I have tried the following solutions, that have been suggested:

* Maximum perfomance battery.

* Turning off G-Sync. (And tried with on).

* Tried all the various graphic settings ingame. (No change)

* Tried capping my framerate, and enabling v-sync. (No change.)

* Disabling X-BOX game DVR. (No Change)

* I've tried windowed, borderless and fullscreen. (Bordeless performences worse)

I start the game out with 90 FPS, and around 20 minutes ingame I'll drop to 45-30 fps. My framerate is so unstable, that it absolutely hinders my perfomance ingame. The computer described above should be able to push 144fps, if not more, in a non-graphic intensive game like league of legends.

If anyone have any suggestions, please let me know. This is getting quite frustrating.

Thanks in advanced,
Hated.

replies.body:
You may wanna check out this article on [**Frame-Skipping**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209010626). I can't really tell what kind of specific issues you're having other than fps dropping (which honestly might be due to corrupted files around the 20 min mark, or simply drops in FPS from teamfights and more going on later in the game).  

Try capping your framerate with that article to see if it helps at all. Other than that, I'd also try repairing the game files through the client options to be sure certain files like come into play around 20 min aren't damaged and causing some issues.
putting a cap actually made the stuttering/skipping worse for me.
Sadly I have already tried these options, as this is the general response I got last time I attempted to submit a support ticket.

Hmmm well dang okay. That does at least help us narrow down what the real issue actually is. You mentioned having that suggested in a support ticket, were you able to keep talking with them or start a new one to try some others things with the techs?
I have opened a new one, hoping for a clear anwser :)
havent played since late december. downloaded update, played today and getting really bad fps stuttering and drops during entire game with a 1080ti when my game has run perfectly since forever.

It's not the first "that kind of" topic which I met, so I'll just copy and paste what I wrote somewhere else earlier: 

Ok.

Your PC is a monster. A MONSTER. And you're telling me, that you must play at very low settings?!
DUDE! Check this out:
-my PC was an antic. Or a toaster. Or something similar with potato:
- Windows 7 32 bit
- Pentium Dual Core E6300
- 2 GB Ram DDR2
- GF 9500 GT
- I don't have a SSD: typical cheap HDD

And with this setup at the lowest settings with Full HD resolution I had problems with frames. Even when LoL was telling me, that I had 37 FPS game was lagging & freezing.

Now I could buy a new & powerful PC but:
1) for ME there is no sense right NOW,
2) I'm poor, so my bank account would be reeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeally thin after that.

So few days ago I did two things:
- I bought GF GT 1030 (so cheap!)
- I checked my system.

When you replied I played one 25 min SR game (because I usually play ARAMS) &... Well:
- I have disabled shadows,
- environment went at medium
- effects went at medium
- characters went at medium
- AA off

And in bigger teamfights I had FPS drops for ~47 but I didn't had any "unpleasantness" with that. Usually I have now 60-59-57 FPS.

So- your situation for me is like trolling or some bad joke 

I'm not a specialist or engineer, but IMO there is something wrong with LoL (but IMO we can put that aside, because that's not the topic to tell about it), but looking at your situation there must be something wrong with yous PC.

You wrote a lot about your hardware, but PC is not only about hardware- it's also about software.

So- could you please tell more about your software:
- I assume you're using Windows, so your windows version & are you patching it with windows update?
- do you use any protection software (antivirus)?
- do you have some benchmarks, or other games, to give a comparison: is LoL only affected with this problem & how other games works at your PC?
Sorry yes, could have been more specific. Lol is the only game I'm getting low fps in. I'm running windows defender/malwarebytes(not running). And running win 10, latest version.

> [{quoted}](name=Hated,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=EUPY0lk2,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2018-01-16T14:31:40.188+0000)
>
> Sorry yes, could have been more specific. Lol is the only game I'm getting low fps in. I'm running windows defender/malwarebytes(not running). And running win 10, latest version.

OK.
You wrote something about things you tried (g-synch etc.)
OK.
So I'll start wit this: Is it possible for you, to download some antivirus (like  Kaspersky free [if yes, you don't need to use it later- you can uninstall it after scan if you don't want it]), install it, update virus database & scan your whole PC?
And after that write results?

EDIT: I assume, that you have the latest GPU drivers (390.65 if I'm not wrong)?

Here is a few articles that might help.

* [Article 1](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209010626)
* [Article 2](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002832247)
* [Article 3](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684)

Try using this [old thread](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3519654) 

It may be old but some of it could still be relevant.

Lots of info, I know, but if these don't work you could send a [ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) 
Also you could [search for more articles on the Riot Support website](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&commit=Search&query=)

I will attempt to send a new ticket, but thank you for the articles. Sadly I have already been through all these solutions multiple times, and haven't gotten any significant impact.

The patch prior to this, I did have about 20 fps more, so I was around a 50-70 fps framerate. But last patch I'm back where I came from, and I'm still sad that I haven't been able to ultilize my 144hz monitor in this game. Just a stable 60fps would be okay I guess :P

Please, tell me you're trolling or joking :S 
If that all is true, then Your PC is a MONSTER.
How on earth you can have FPS problems?!
...
Pls tell me you're joking...
I am sadly not joking, that is indeed the case :(

He's not, i'm having a VERY similar issue and my PC is more or less same specs as his. 
I've heard its issues with 1080+ cards. I have also tried trouble shooting EVERYTHING. 

The latest patch has seemed to have made everything worse, I can barely farm in lane now. 

I have a similar post I made yesterday, no clear cut solution. People offer the troubleshooting by riot, no avail for me. GG

> I start the game out with 90 FPS, and around 20 minutes ingame I'll drop to 45-30 fps.

So I assume, that you're talking about typical games at SR, right? Or you talk about ARAM games at HA?
